column3: Just keep on crawling across the basin

They bloomed a lot later this year too, way into middle and late April.

I'm sure the people here are well aware of the risks and have taken steps, but it might be wise for shareholders to hedge some/most/all of their holding, but that's just a passing thought, not advice, 'cause I'm not an advisor and my guesses are often plain wrong.

Good luck everyone :))

Well, these movement are based on insurance models, not climate models
Don‚Äôt they use the same meteorology simulations?

Sort of, but the insurance models are only built to predict the next year‚Äôs season. It‚Äôs just historic weather ‚Äì they don‚Äôt care about emissions, and they don‚Äôt have a measure of the climate itself changing.
And the price is built off of that
Yeah, the price represents the collateralised value at risk for a major cat event, or the expected losses across the industry that season.
